description: The OSRS OSINT Source Authors galaxy is used for the tracking of authors in association to the OSINT artificats collected.
name: OSRS-OSINT-Source-Authors

values.description: Test place holder

Brian Krebs is an American journalist and investigative reporter. He is best known for his coverage of profit-seeking cybercriminals. His interest grew after a computer worm locked him out of his own computer in 2001. Krebs is the author of a daily blog, KrebsOnSecurity.com, covering computer security and cybercrime.

Pierluigi Paganini is CTO at Cybaze Enterprise SpA Pierluigi is member of the ENISA (European Union Agency for Network and Information Security) Threat Landscape Stakeholder Group, member of Cyber G7 Workgroup of the Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation, Professor and Director of the Master in Cyber Security at the Link Campus University. Editor-in-Chief at Cyber Defense Magazine, Pierluigi is a cyber security expert with over 20 years experience in the field, he is Certified Ethical Hacker at EC Council in London. The passion for writing and a strong belief that security is founded on sharing and awareness led Pierluigi to find the security blog Security Affairs recently named a Top National Security Resource for US. Pierluigi is a member of the The Hacker News team and he is a writer for some major publications in the field such as Cyber War Zone, ICTTF, Infosec Island, Infosec Institute, The Hacker News Magazine and for many other Security magazines.
Informational extention of the anti-virus company TrendMicro.

Reverse engineer with a deep knowledge of x86 and x64 assembly, proficient in using several debuggers and disassemblers (OllyDBG, WinDBG, IDA) and other reversing tools. Abilities include reversing applications under Windows, Linux and Android platforms, exploits (OLE, PDF, Java) and scripts. Has detailed knowledge of PE executables and Windows internals. Software engineer with experience in developing applications in C as well as C++ and Java. Prolific blogger and IT security conference speaker.
Fraud researcher with the anti-virus vendor TrendMicro.
Red Team Consultant at Mandiant (FireEye).

Blog extension of the organization Yoroi.  Yoroi is a managed security service provider. It provides cyber security solutions against industrial espionage, internal threats and advanced targeted attacks. Yoroi offers an high specialized Security Operation Center (SOC) to protect your company.

Malware Analyst | Security Researcher @Yoroi ZLab - Cybaze SpA. Antonio graduated in Software Engineering at the University of Sannio. Antonio is now part of ZLab, the malware analysis team of Yoroi Cybaze.

Malware Analyst | Security Researcher @Yoroi ZLab - Cybaze SpA. Davide graduated in Software Engineering at the University of Sannio. Davide is now part of ZLab, the malware analysis team of Yoroi Cybaze.

Malware Analyst | Security Researcher @Yoroi ZLab - Cybaze SpA. Antonio graduated in Computer Engineering at the University of Sannio. He is the director of ZLab, the malware analysis team of Yoroi Cybaze.

Only a few years removed from college, I am using my training as a journalist to inform consumers, researchers and executives in the cybersecurity field now as a technical editor and writer at Cisco Talos.
Zack Whittaker is the security editor at TechCrunch.
Malware researcher and author at Cisco Talos.

Catalin Cimpanu is a security reporter at ZDNet, where he covers cyber-security, data breaches, hacking, and other related topics. He previously served as security reporter for Bleeping Computer and Softpedia. Catalin is based in Romania.
ABC affiliate out of Phoenix Arizona.
Inc42 staff writer. As a recent Post-Graduate in Journalism, Kritti is still exploring the real world. She's currently working as a Journalist at Inc42, and enjoys the art of multimedia storytelling.
Computer security researcher and a software developer, living in Denmark.
Test place holder
Security researcher, Cisco Talos.

I'm an experienced machine learning developer that applies natural language processing and computer vision in order to detect fraud, platform abuse, and cybersecurity threats. Rather than learning malicious patterns from text, images, and binaries, my doctoral work focused on learning memory patterns from spiking neural networks. My research concerning the intersection of artificial intelligence and cybersecurity has been presented at RSA, Black Hat, DEF CON, and a NeurIPS workshop, and it's been covered by The New York Times, BBC, TechCrunch, The Wall Street Journal, CNN, The Atlantic, KrebsOnSecurity, and more.
FireEye security researcher.
FireEye security researcher.
FireEye security researcher.
Author on the Pentestlab.blog site. Typically publishes information regarding offensive security methods.

Francesca Fionda is an investigative journalist based in Vancouver reporting for Attention Control. The podcast explores misinformation, technology and data during our upcoming federal election. She has also worked as a data reporter at the community-driven journalism organization, The Discourse and on investigative teams at Global News and the CBC.
Staff journalist for news site HAARETZ.

Ionut Ilascu is freelancing as a technology writer with a focus on all things cybersecurity. The topics he writes about include malware, vulnerabilities, exploits and security defenses, as well as research and innovation in information security. His work has been published by Bitdefender, Netgear, The Security Ledger and Softpedia.
Author group as an extension of the Symantec Security Blog.
values.value: Symantec Security Response Attack Investigation Team

values.description: Author and blogger with Cisco Talos Group.

Holger is a long term security enthusiast started to work for Siemens as a telecommunication specialist building Hicom PBX systems and later networking systems. After passing the CCIE exam, he moved to Cisco 16 years ago, worked as penetration tester and as security consultant supporting large customer projects. His last job role at Cisco was leading the Cyber Security Technical Advisor Group in EMEA. Holger is now working as a Security Researcher in TALOS. He did security research in a couple of sectors like botnet technology, sandbox bypassing, VPN MITM and developed several tools for penetration testing.

Edmund Brumaghin is a threat researcher with Cisco Talos. He has spent the past several years protecting environments across a number of different industries including nuclear energy, financial services, etc. He currently spends his days hunting malware and analyzing various threats as they emerge and continue to evolve. In his time with Talos he has researched ransomware and other threats being distributed using various attack vectors. He has also worked to expose large scale malware campaigns and raise awareness of security threats observed across the threat landscape.
Charlie Osborne is a cybersecurity journalist and photographer who writes for ZDNet and CNET from London.
Author name for research published by the anti-virus company ESET.
Security researcher with both Checkpoint and Kaspersky.
Security research with Checkpoint.

CTU researchers use a wide variety of commercial and proprietary toolsets to produce, analyze and validate threat intelligence. CTU researchers perform thorough analysis to discover new attack techniques and threats.
values.value: Secureworks COUNTER THREAT UNIT RESEARCH TEAM

values.description: Pseudonym used for publications from security vendor Fortinet.

Vitali oversees subject matter expert collection efforts and leads a technical team that specializes in researching and investigating complex cyber attacks, network intrusions, data breaches, and hacking incidents. Vitali is a strong believer in responsible disclosure and has helped enterprises and government agencies deliver indictments of many high-profile investigations involving data breaches, network intrusions, ransomware, computer hacking, intellectual property theft, credit card fraud, money laundering, and identity theft. Previously, Vitali enjoyed a rewarding career as a Cybercrime Investigative Analyst for the New York County District Attorney's Office.
Author and researcher with Cisco Talos Group.
Author and researcher with Cisco Talos Group.
Security researcher with anti-virus vendor TrendMicro.
Security researcher with anti-virus vendor TrendMicro.

An experienced IT writer and editor, I've spent the past 14+ years honing my skills, building my contacts and broadening my horizons. At PM Media I now provide a comprehensive range of copywriting and media consultancy services to a wide variety of clients, albeit with a technology bias. I've been able to consistently deliver compelling copy on time and to brief, including blogs; white papers; case studies; EDMs; awards entries; and bylined opinion articles. Clients past and present include Microsoft, Cisco, Lenovo, Barclaycard, Worldpay, Trend Micro, Ferrero, and PayPal.
